source_string: Hi! We are excited to have you play some games with us today!
translation: ¡Hola! ¡Estamos encantados de que juegues hoy con nosotros!

source_string: First, you get to choose a buddy to play along with you. As you complete the different games, you will get to pick an accessory like a hat or glasses to decorate your buddy.
translation: En primer lugar, tienes que elegir a un amigo para que juegue contigo. A medida que completes los diferentes juegos, podrás elegir un accesorio como un sombrero o unas gafas para decorar a tu amigo.

source_string: Pick a buddy to play with!
translation: ¡Escoge un amigo para jugar!

source_string: Now that you have your buddy, we want to explain how the games work.
translation: Ahora que ya tienes a tu amigo, queremos explicarte cómo funcionan los juegos.

source_string: During the games you will need to listen to instructions so make sure your speakers are on and the volume is the way you like it. If you need to hear the instructions again, you can click the speaker button up in the corner of your screen.
translation: Durante los juegos tendrás que escuchar las instrucciones, así que asegúrate de que los altavoces están encendidos y el volumen está a tu gusto. Si necesitas volver a escuchar las instrucciones, presiona el botón del altavoz situado en la esquina superior de la pantalla.

source_string:
You can choose your answers in different ways depending on the type of tablet or computer you are using. You can use a mouse or touchpad to click your choice, you can use the arrow keys on your keyboard, or you can touch your screen if you are using a tablet. You can pick the way that works best for you.

If you have any questions or need help getting started, please ask the adult who is nearby to help you.
translation:
Puedes elegir tus respuestas de diferentes maneras dependiendo del tipo de tableta u ordenador que estés utilizando. Puedes utilizar un ratón o un panel táctil para hacer clic en tu elección, puedes utilizar las teclas de flecha del teclado o puedes tocar la pantalla si utilizas una tableta. Puedes elegir la forma que más te convenga.

Si tienes alguna duda o necesitas ayuda para empezar, pide ayuda al adulto que esté cerca.

source_string: You've completed the game. Thank you!
translation: Has completado el juego. ¡Gracias!

source_string: OK
translation: Ok

source_string: Close
translation: Cerrar

source_string: Click the button below or press ANY KEY to continue
translation: Haz clic en el botón abajo o presiona CUALQUIER TECLA para continuar

source_string: instructions
translation: instrucciones

source_string: Keep Going!
translation: ¡Continúa!

source_string: Great! That's right.
translation: ¡Genial! Eso es correcto.

source_string: Please try again!
translation: ¡Inténtalo de nuevo!

source_string: Good job!
translation: ¡Bien hecho!

source_string: Nice work!
translation: ¡Muy bien!

source_string: Press the speaker button if you want the question repeated.
translation: Presiona el botón del altavoz si deseas que se repita la pregunta.

source_string: Switch to full screen mode
translation: Cambiar al modo de pantalla completa

source_string: Looks like this is a little tricky! Let’s review the instructions.
translation: ¡Parece que esto es un poco complicado! Repasemos las instrucciones.

source_string: If you want to use your keyboard to answer a question, press the arrow key shown next to your choice.
translation: Si desea utilizar su teclado para responder una pregunta, presione la tecla de flecha que se muestra junto a su elección.

source_string: You've finished the instructions. Thank you!
translation: Has terminado las instrucciones. ¡Gracias!

source_string: Exit
translation: Salir

source_string: You've finished this game. Thank you!
translation: Has terminado este juego. ¡Gracias!

source_string: We’re going to show you a puzzle, and your job is to pick the best piece to complete the puzzle. Let's get started!
translation: Vamos a mostrarte un rompecabezas. Tu tarea es elegir la mejor pieza para completarlo. ¡Empecemos!

source_string: See this big puzzle? It's missing a piece! Which piece goes in the puzzle?
translation: ¿Ves este gran rompecabezas? Le falta una pieza. ¿Cuál pieza va en el rompecabezas?

source_string: Choose the best pattern to fill in the blank.
translation: Escoge el mejor patrón para llenar el espacio en blanco.

source_string: Do you see these two outlines? One goes with this shape. Let’s see which one goes with the shape.
translation: ¿Ves estas dos siluetas? Una va con esta figura. Veamos cuál va con la figura.

source_string: Let's see if this shape goes with the outline. This shape doesn’t go with the outline.
translation: Veamos si esta figura va con la silueta. Esta figura no va con la silueta.

source_string: Let's see if this shape goes with the outline. This shape does go with the outline.
translation: Veamos si esta figura va con la silueta. Esta figura sí va con la silueta.

source_string: Now you try! Can you find the shape that goes with the outline?
translation: ¡Ahora, inténtalo tú! ¿Puedes encontrar la figura que va con la silueta?

source_string: Now you will see pictures that look like real blocks with three sides. Can you find the shapes that go with the blocks?
translation: Ahora verás dibujos que parecen bloques de verdad con tres lados. Puedes encontrar las formas que van con los bloques?

source_string: Choose the picture that matches this one.
translation: Escoge la imagen que coincida con esta.

source_string: Choose the matching picture.
translation: Escoge la imagen que coincide.

source_string: In this game, you will do some math problems. Some will be like the ones you do in school and some will be a little different than what you do in school. Some questions might be easy for you and some might be hard. That is okay! Please try your best and take your time. Most of the questions will have four choices. You choose the one you think is right. Let’s get started!
translation: En este juego, harás algunos problemas de matemáticas. Algunos serán como los que haces en la escuela y otros serán un poco diferentes de los que haces en la escuela. Algunas preguntas te resultarán fáciles y otras difíciles. ¡No pasa nada! Esfuérzate al máximo y tómate tu tiempo. La mayoría de las preguntas tienen cuatro opciones. Eliges la que consideres correcta. ¡Empecemos!

source_string: Which number is larger?
translation: ¿Cuál número es mayor?

source_string: Which is larger?
translation: ¿Cuál es mayor?

source_string: Choose the number you hear.
translation: Escoge el número cuando lo escuches.

source_string: What number goes in the blank?
translation: ¿Cuál número va en el espacio en blanco?

source_string: What number goes here?

source_string: Add the numbers and choose the correct answer.
translation: Suma los números y escoge la respuesta correcta.

source_string: Add the numbers.
translation: Suma los números.

source_string: Subtract the numbers and choose the correct answer.

source_string: Subtract the numbers.

source_string: Multiply the numbers and choose the correct answer.

source_string: Multiply the numbers.

source_string: Here is a number line. You can move the red line forward and backward along the black line. Move the red line so it is in the right place to show where the number would fit. Make sure you look at the numbers at each end when deciding where to move the red line.

source_string: Choose the number that is marked on the number line.

source_string: Move the red line to mark the number.
translation: Pon la barra roja sobre la linea recta en el lugar del número indicado.

source_string: This is the Stories Game. In this game, you will listen to some stories. Then you will answer question about the stories.
translation: Este es el Juego de las historias. En este juego vas a escuchar algunas historias y luego vas a responder preguntas sobre esas historias.

source_string: Nice work! Here is a new story.
translation: ¡Bien hecho! Ahora vamos con una nueva historia.

source_string: Here is Madison. This morning, Madison put her book behind the chair, because she didn’t want anyone to find it.
translation: Esta es Marisol. Esta mañana, Marisol puso su libro detrás de la silla, porque no quería que nadie lo encontrara.

source_string: But when Madison was outside playing, someone did find it! And hid it under the rug.
translation: Pero, cuando Marisol estaba afuera jugando, ¡alguien lo encontró! Y lo escondió debajo de la alfombra.

source_string: So now it’s reading time and Madison wants her book.
translation: Ahora, es el momento de leer y Marisol quiere su libro.

source_string: Where will Madison look first for her book?
translation: ¿Dónde buscará Marisol su libro primero?

source_string: Behind the chair
translation: Detrás de la silla

source_string: Under the rug
translation: Debajo de la alfombra

source_string: And where is her book really?
translation: ¿Y dónde está realmente su libro?

source_string: Look, Madison found her book! How do you think she feels about finding her book?
translation: ¡Mira, Marisol encontró su libro! ¿Cómo crees que se siente por haber encontrado su libro?

source_string: This morning when he came to school, Ethan put his book on the shelf above the coat hooks. Ethan’s book is blue!
translation: Esta mañana, cuando vino a la escuela, Elián puso su libro sobre la repisa encima de los colgaderos de abrigos. El libro de Elián es azul.

source_string: And then he went outside to play, see? Here’s Ethan playing outside. And while he was outside playing, Ethan’s book fell down from above the coat hooks onto the floor under the coats, see?
translation: Y luego salió a jugar, ¿ves? Aquí está Elián jugando afuera. Mientras Elián estaba afuera jugando, su libro se cayó de la repisa y quedó en el piso, debajo de los abrigos, ¿ves?

source_string: Then Hannah comes in and Hannah puts her book up above the coat hooks. Hannah's book is also blue! Ethan is still outside playing, so he didn't see what Hannah was doing.
translation: Luego entró Ana y puso su libro sobre la repisa encima de los colgaderos. ¡El libro de Ana también es azul! Como Elián todavía está afuera jugando, no vio lo que hizo Ana.

source_string: Now, when Ethan comes in from outside, where will he look first for his book?
translation: Entonces, cuando Elián regrese, ¿dónde buscará primero su libro?

source_string: On the shelf
translation: Sobre la repisa

source_string: Under the coats
translation: Debajo de los abrigos

source_string: Let’s see what he does. Oh look, here is Ethan reaching for this book up on the shelf. And now Hannah sees Ethan reaching for that book... the book that is Hannah's!
translation: Veamos lo que Elián hace. Oh, mira, Elián está cogiendo el libro que está sobre la repisa. Y ahora Ana ve a Elián cogiendo ese libro... ¡el libro que es de Ana!

source_string: How do you think Hannah feels about Ethan reaching for that book?
translation: ¿Cómo crees que se siente Ana cuando Elián coge ese libro?

source_string: How do you think Hannah would feel if she had not seen Ethan reaching for the book?
translation: ¿Cómo crees que se sentiría Ana si no hubiera visto a Elián coger el libro?

source_string: Is Ethan being mean and naughty for taking Hannah's book?
translation: ¿Elián está siendo malo y travieso al tomar el libro de Ana?

source_string: Should Ethan get in trouble with the teacher for taking Hannah's book?
translation: ¿Debería Elián estar en problemas con el maestro por tomar el libro de Ana?

source_string: Can you help Hannah find her book? Is it on the shelf or under the coats?
translation: ¿Puedes ayudar a Ana a encontrar su libro? ¿Está sobre la repisa o debajo de los abrigos?

source_string: Can you help Ethan find his book? Is it on the shelf or under the coats?
translation: ¿Puedes ayudar a Elián a encontrar su libro? ¿Está sobre la repisa o debajo de los abrigos?

source_string: Joshua, Isabel, and Ivan are playing a game. Here's how the game goes: One kid hides, but draws a clue in the sandbox so the other kids can find them.
translation: Johan, Isabel e Iván están jugando. El juego es el siguiente: Uno de los niños se esconde, pero debe dibujar una pista en la arena que permita a los otros niños encontrarlo.

source_string: So Ivan is going first. He draws this clue in the sandbox, and then he goes to hide.
translation: Entonces, Iván va primero. Dibuja esta pista en la arena y se esconde.

source_string: Now it's Joshua's turn to leave a clue, and hide. Isabel and Ivan will then try to use the clue to find him.
translation: Ahora le toca a Johan dejar una pista y esconderse. Isabel e Iván intentarán utilizar la pista para encontrarlo.

source_string: Joshua decides to hide behind the fountain. He draws a clue in the sand. He tries to draw the fountain, with the bottom part and the water coming out of it. But the drawing looks like a tree instead! Then Joshua goes to hide behind the fountain.
translation: Johan decide esconderse detrás de la fuente. Él dibuja una pista en la arena. Él intenta dibujar la parte inferior de la fuente y el agua que sale de ella, ¡pero el dibujo que hace parece un árbol! Ahora, Johan se esconde detrás de la fuente.

source_string: What did Joshua mean to draw?
translation: ¿Qué quería dibujar Johan?

source_string: A fountain
translation: Una fuente

source_string: A tree
translation: Un árbol

source_string: When Isabel and Ivan see this clue, where will they look first for Joshua?
translation: Cuando Isabel e Iván vean esta pista, ¿dónde buscarán primero a Johan?

source_string: Can you help them find where Joshua really is?
translation: ¿Puedes ayudarles a encontrar dónde está realmente Johan?

source_string: Behind the fountain
translation: Detrás de la fuente

source_string: Behind the tree
translation: Detrás del árbol

source_string: Look, Isabel and Ivan found Joshua, and won the game! How do you think Isabel feels about winning the game?
translation: ¡Mira, Isabel e Iván encontraron a Joshua y ganaron el juego! ¿Cómo crees que se siente Isabel por ganar el juego?

source_string: Now the games are over, and it's almost time to go home. Mother tells the kids to find all of their toys.
translation: Ya se acabaron los juegos y es hora de volver a casa. Mamá les dice a los niños que busquen todos sus juguetes.

source_string: Joshua brought his toy truck with him to the park, but now he can't find it. He's looking everywhere but he can't find it.
translation: Johan trajo su camión de juguete al parque, pero ahora no lo encuentra. Lo busca por todas partes, pero no puede encontrarlo.

source_string: How does Joshua feel about losing his truck?
translation: ¿Cómo se siente Johan por perder su camión?

source_string: How would Joshua feel if he found his truck?
translation: ¿Cómo se sentiría Johan si encontrara su camión?

source_string: Joshua can't find his truck because earlier in the day, when no one was looking, Isabel took the toy truck and buried it in the sandbox.
translation: Johan no encuentra su camión porque antes, cuando nadie miraba, Isabel cogió el camión de juguete y lo enterró en la arena.

source_string: So Joshua looks everywhere and he can't find his toy truck. Mother gets mad at Joshua, because he lost his truck.
translation: Por eso, Johan mira por todas partes y no encuentra su camión de juguete. Mamá se enoja con Johan porque perdió el camión.

source_string: Is it fair that Mother is mad at Joshua for losing his truck?
translation: ¿Es justo que Mamá se enoje con Johan por haber perdido su camión?

source_string: Is Mother mad at Isabel?
translation: ¿Mamá está enojada con Isabel?

source_string: Is Joshua mad at Isabel?
translation: ¿Johan está enojado con Isabel?

source_string: When Isabel sees that Mother is mad at Joshua, she goes to the sandbox and digs up the toy truck, and gives it back to Joshua.
translation: Cuando Isabel se da cuenta de que Mamá está enojada con Johan, va al patio de arena, saca el juguete de la arena y se lo devuelve a Johan.

source_string: Is Mother mad at Joshua now?
translation: ¿Ahora Mamá está enojada con Johan?

source_string: Is Mother mad at Isabel now?
translation: ¿Ahora Mamá está enojada con Isabel?

source_string: Is Joshua mad at Isabel now?
translation: ¿Ahora Johan está enojado con Isabel?

source_string: Isabel tells Joshua that she’s very sorry, and she gives him a big hug. Joshua gives her a big hug back, and Mother joins in.
translation: Isabel le pide disculpas a Johan y le da un fuerte abrazo. Johan le devuelve el abrazo, y Mamá se une a ellos.

source_string: This is Katie. Earlier today, Katie's mom was cleaning the house, while Katie watched. Mom left three cups in the kitchen. There is a small cup on the counter, a medium sized cup on the table, and a big cup that she put away up high, on the shelf.
translation: Ella es Carla. Hace un rato, la mamá de María limpiaba la casa mientras María observaba. La mamá dejó tres tazas en la cocina: hay una taza pequeña en la barra, una taza mediana en la mesa y una taza grande en un estante que está muy alto.

source_string: Katie and Dad just walked in and Katie asks her dad to get her a cup. Katie tells her Dad, “I want the big cup!”
translation: Carla y Papá acaban de entrar y Carla le pide a su papá que le de una taza. Carla le dice a su papá "¡quiero la taza grande!".

source_string: Which cup will Dad give Katie?
translation: ¿Cuál taza le dará el Papá a Carla?

source_string: Which cup does Katie want?
translation: ¿Cuál taza quiere Carla?

source_string: The small cup
translation: La taza pequeña

source_string: The medium sized cup
translation: La taza mediana

source_string: The big cup
translation: La taza grande

source_string: How does Katie feel about not getting the cup she wanted?
translation: ¿Cómo se siente Carla por no haber recibido la taza que quería?

source_string: How would Katie feel if she had received the cup she wanted?
translation: ¿Cómo se sentiría Carla si hubiera recibido la taza que quería?

source_string: Sam and Maria are playing together. They look outside and see a new shop across the street. Maria tells Sam: “I am going to buy new shirts for us there,” and she walks away.
translation: Sam y María están jugando juntos. Cuando miran hacia afuera ven una tienda nueva al otro lado de la calle. María le dice a Sam: "voy a ir a comprar camisetas nuevas para nosotros" y se va.

source_string: Mom comes home and she tells Sam that she just walked by the shop. “Are they selling shirts?” Sam asks. “No,” Mom says, “They are only selling shoes”. “Maria will probably now get shoes at the shop,” Sam says.
translation: Mamá llega a casa y le dice a Sam que acaba de pasar por la tienda. "¿Venden camisetas?" pregunta Sam. "No", dice Mamá, "solo venden zapatos". "Probablemente ahora María va a comprar zapatos en la tienda", dice Sam.

source_string: Does Maria know that they are selling shoes in the shop?
translation: ¿María sabe que en la tienda venden zapatos?

source_string: Maria has arrived at the shop. “I would like to buy shirts,” she says. “All we have left are socks,” says the shopkeeper. Since Maria also needs socks, she decides to get some socks.
translation: María llega a la tienda y dice "me gustaría comprar camisas." La vendedora responde "Sólo nos quedan medias." Como María también necesita medias, decide comprar algunos pares.

source_string: Does Sam know that Maria bought some socks?
translation: ¿Sam sabe que María ha comprado medias?

source_string: What does Sam think they are selling at the shop?
translation: ¿Qué cree Sam que venden en la tienda?

source_string: Shoes
translation: Zapatos

source_string: Socks
translation: Medias

source_string: Shirts
translation: Camisetas

source_string:
On her way back, Maria meets her dad. She tells her dad: “I have just bought some socks. I am going to share them with my brother Sam. It is a surprise.”
“That is nice of you,” says Dad. Then he asks Maria: “Does Sam know what you bought him?”
translation:
Caminando de regreso, María se encuentra con su padre. Ella le dice "acabo de comprar unas medias. Voy a compartirlas con mi hermano Sam. Es una sorpresa".
"Es muy amable de tu parte", dice Papá. Luego le pregunta a María: "¿Sam sabe qué le has comprado?".

source_string: What does Maria tell Dad?
translation: ¿Qué le dice María a Papá?

source_string: Then Dad asks: “What does Sam think they are selling at the shop?”
translation: Entonces Papá pregunta: "¿Qué cree Sam que venden en la tienda?".

source_string: What does Maria tell Dad?
translation: ¿Qué le dice María a Papá?

source_string: What does Sam think they are selling at the shop?
translation: ¿Qué cree Sam que venden en la tienda?

source_string: Sam is very happy to get his new socks.
translation: Sam está muy contento de recibir sus medias nuevas.

source_string: Imagine that you are walking to school and you’re wearing your new shoes. You really like your new shoes and this is the first day you have worn them.
translation: Imagina que vas camino a la escuela y llevas puestos tus zapatos nuevos. Te gustan mucho tus zapatos nuevos y es la primera vez que los usas.

source_string: Suddenly, you are bumped from behind by a boy. You stumble and fall into a mud puddle and your new shoes get muddy.
translation: De repente, un chico te choca por detrás. Tropiezas y caes en un charco de barro y tus zapatos nuevos se ensucian de barro

source_string: Do you think that the boy bumped you on purpose or by accident?
translation: ¿Crees que el chico te golpeó a propósito o por accidente?

source_string: Now pick one of the three choices as the one you would do:
translation: Ahora escoge cuál de estas tres opciones harías tú:

source_string: clean up my shoes
translation: limpiar mis zapatos

source_string: walk away from the boy
translation: alejarme del chico

source_string: push the boy in the mud
translation: empujar al chico al barro

source_string: Imagine that you are on the playground. You and some other kids are having a race. A boy is standing on the side, bouncing a basketball.
translation: Imagina que estás en el patio de recreo. Tú y otros niños están haciendo una carrera. Un niño está parado a un lado, haciendo rebotar una pelota de baloncesto.

source_string: The next thing you know, the boy has bounced the ball and it has rolled under your feet, making you fall. You skin your knee and someone else wins the race.
translation: De repente, el chico hace rebotar la pelota y rueda bajo tus pies, haciéndote caer. Te raspas la rodilla, y alguien más gana la carrera.

source_string: Do you think that the boy made you fall on purpose or by accident?
translation: ¿Crees que el chico te hizo caer a propósito o por accidente?

source_string: Now pick one of the three choices as the one you would do:
translation: Ahora escoge cuál de estas tres opciones harías tú:

source_string: go to another area of the playground
translation: ir a otra zona del patio de recreo

source_string: say something mean to him
translation: insultar al niño

source_string: take care of my knee
translation: curar mi rodilla

source_string: Imagine that you are working on an assignment at your desk.
translation: Imagina que estás trabajando en una tarea en tu escritorio.

source_string: You go to sharpen your pencil, and as you walk back to your desk there is a boy walking just in front of you. The boy passes your desk before you get there.
translation: Te levantas para sacarle punta a tu lápiz y, de regreso a tu escritorio, vas detrás de un niño que camina justo delante de ti. El niño pasa por tu escritorio antes de que tú llegues.

source_string: The next thing you know, the boy has knocked all of your papers off of your desk, and they are all over the floor.
translation: De repente, el chico tira todos los papeles que estaban en tu escritorio y ahora están regados en el suelo.

source_string: Do you think the boy knocked your papers onto the floor on purpose or by accident?
translation: ¿Crees que el chico tiró tus papeles al suelo a propósito o por accidente?

source_string: Now pick one of the three choices as the one you would do:
translation: Ahora escoge cuál de estas tres opciones harías tú:

source_string: call him a name
translation: insultar al niño

source_string: pick up the papers
translation: recoger los papeles

source_string: do nothing
translation: no hacer nada

source_string: by accident
translation: por accidente

source_string: on purpose
translation: a propósito

source_string: by accident
translation: por accidente

source_string: on purpose
translation: a propósito

source_string: by accident
translation: por accidente

source_string: on purpose
translation: a propósito

source_string: This is the matching game. In this game, you're going to choose sets of cards that match in some way. First, let's look at some of the cards you are going to see.
translation: Este es el juego de parejas. En este juego, vas a elegir conjuntos de cartas que se parecen de alguna manera. Primero, veamos algunas de las cartas que vas a ver.

source_string: Choose the card with a circle.
translation: Escoge la carta que tiene un círculo.

source_string: Choose the card with a square.
translation: Escoge la carta que tiene un cuadrado.

source_string: Choose the card with a triangle.
translation: Escoge la carta que tiene un triángulo.

source_string: Choose the card with a star.
translation: Escoge la carta que tiene una estrella.

source_string: Choose the card with a green shape.
translation: Escoge la carta que tiene una figura verde.

source_string: Choose the card with a red shape.
translation: Escoge la carta que tiene una figura roja.

source_string: Choose the card with a blue shape.
translation: Escoge la carta que tiene una figura azul.

source_string: Choose the card with a yellow shape.
translation: Escoge la carta que tiene una figura amarilla.

source_string: Choose the card with a small shape.
translation: Escoge la carta que tiene una figura pequeña.

source_string: Choose the card with a medium-sized shape.
translation: Escoge la carta que tiene una figura mediana.

source_string: Choose the card with a large shape.
translation: Escoge la carta que tiene una figura grande.

source_string: Choose the star on the white card.
translation: Escoge la estrella en la carta blanca.

source_string: Choose the star on the gray card.
translation: Escoge la estrella en la carta gris.

source_string: Choose the star on the black card.
translation: Escoge la estrella en la carta negra.

source_string: Choose the star on the striped card.
translation: Escoge la estrella en la carta con rayas.

source_string: Choose the card with 1 star.
translation: Escoge la carta con 1 estrella.

source_string: Choose the card with 2 stars.
translation: Escoge la carta con 2 estrellas.

source_string: Choose the card with 3 stars.
translation: Escoge la carta con 3 estrellas.

source_string: Choose the card with 4 stars.
translation: Escoge la carta con 4 estrellas.

source_string: Now you're going to see two cards that are the same in one way. Then you will see a new card that is similar to one of those cards. Your job is to choose the card that is similar to the new card.
translation: Ahora vas a ver dos cartas que son iguales de alguna manera. Luego vas a ver una nueva carta que se parece a una de esas cartas. Tu trabajo es elegir la carta que se parece en algo a esa nueva carta.

source_string: Now you're going to see three cards, and you're going to choose two that are the same in some way. Then you're going to see the same cards again, and pick two cards that are the same in a different way.
translation: Ahora vas a ver tres cartas y debes escoger dos que sean iguales de alguna manera. Luego vas a ver las mismas tres cartas, pero  vas a escoger otras dos cartas que sean iguales de alguna otra manera.

source_string: Here are two cards. Something's the same. They both have circles.
translation: Aquí hay dos cartas. Son iguales en algo. Ambas tienen círculos.

source_string: Here are two cards. Something's the same. They both have squares.
translation: Aquí hay dos cartas. Son iguales en algo. Ambas tienen cuadrados.

source_string: Here are two cards. Something's the same. They both have triangles.
translation: Aquí hay dos cartas. Son iguales en algo. Ambas tienen triángulos.

source_string: Here are two cards. Something's the same. They both have red shapes.
translation: Aquí hay dos cartas. Son iguales en algo. Ambas tienen figuras rojas.

source_string: Here are two cards. Something's the same. They both have green shapes.
translation: Aquí hay dos cartas. Son iguales en algo. Ambas tienen figuras verdes.

source_string: Here are two cards. Something's the same. They both have yellow shapes.
translation: Aquí hay dos cartas. Son iguales en algo. Ambas tienen figuras amarillas.

source_string: Here are two cards. Something's the same. They both have blue shapes.
translation: Aquí hay dos cartas. Son iguales en algo. Ambas tienen figuras azules.

source_string: Here are two cards. Something's the same. They both have small shapes.
translation: Aquí hay dos cartas. Son iguales en algo. Ambas tienen figuras pequeñas.

source_string: Here are two cards. Something's the same. They both have medium-sized shapes.
translation: Aquí hay dos cartas. Son iguales en algo. Ambas tienen figuras medianas.

source_string: Here are two cards. Something's the same. They both have large shapes.
translation: Aquí hay dos cartas. Son iguales en algo. Ambas tienen figuras grandes.

source_string: Here is another card. Which of these is similar to this one?
translation: Aquí hay otra carta. ¿Cuál de estas tiene algo que es igual a esta?

source_string: Here is the same set of cards again. Choose two cards that are the same in a different way.
translation: Aquí están otra vez las mismas cartas. Ahora debe escoger dos cartas que sean pareja porque son iguales en algo diferente.

source_string: Here is a new set of cards. Choose two cards that are the same in some way.
translation: Aquí hay un nuevo grupo de cartas. Escoge dos cartas que sean iguales en algún aspecto.

source_string: Choose two cards that are the same in a different way.
translation: Escoge dos cartas que sean pareja porque son iguales en algo diferente.

source_string: Choose three cards that are the same in only one way.
translation: Escoge tres cartas que sean iguales en un solo aspecto.

source_string: Choose another three cards that are the same in only one way.
translation: Escoge otras tres cartas que sean iguales en un solo aspecto.

source_string: Watch the squares light up.
translation: Observa se iluminan los cuadrados.

source_string: Touch the squares in the same order.
translation: Toca los cuadrados en el mismo orden.

source_string: This is the memory game. Here's how you play it.
translation: Este es el juego de la memoria. Las reglas son las siguientes.

source_string: You will see squares light up.
translation: Verás que los cuadrados se iluminan.

source_string: You're going to touch the squares in the same order.
translation: Vas a tocar los cuadrados en el mismo orden.

source_string: Watch carefully! Try to remember the order.
translation: ¡Observa con atención! Intenta recordar el orden.

source_string: Choose the squares in the same order.
translation: Escoge los cuadrados en el mismo orden.

source_string: That's not right. Try again. Choose the squares in the same order.
translation: La respuesta no es correcta.  Inténtalo de nuevo. Escoge los cuadrados en el mismo orden.

source_string: This time the game won't tell you if you're right or wrong. Let’s start playing the memory game!
translation: Esta vez el juego no te dirá si la respuesta es correcta o no. ¡Empecemos a jugar al juego de memoria!

source_string: Let’s start playing the memory game!
translation: ¡Empecemos a jugar al juego de memoria!

source_string: Choose the squares in the backward order.
translation: Escoge los cuadrados en orden inverso.

source_string: This is the heart game. Here's how you play it.
translation: Este es el juego del corazón. Las reglas son las siguientes.

source_string: When you see a heart, press the button on the same side.
translation: Cuando veas un corazón, presiona el botón del mismo lado.

source_string: That's not right. Try again.
translation: La respuesta no es correcta.  Inténtalo de nuevo.

source_string: The heart is on the right side. Press the right button.
translation: El corazón está en el lado derecho. Presiona el botón derecho.

source_string: Time to practice!
translation: ¡Es hora de practicar!

source_string: Remember! When you see a HEART, press the button on the SAME side.
translation: ¡Recuerda! Cuando veas un CORAZÓN, presiona el botón del MISMO lado.

source_string: This time the game will go faster. It won't tell you if you are right or wrong. Try to keep up!
translation: Esta vez el juego irá más rápido. No te dirá si la respuesta es correcta o no. ¡Trata de seguir el ritmo!

source_string: Try to answer as fast as you can without making mistakes. If you make a mistake, just keep going!
translation: Intenta responder lo más rápido que puedas sin cometer errores. Si cometes un error, ¡sigue adelante!

source_string: Time to play!
translation: ¡Hora de jugar!

source_string: This is the flower game. Here's how you play it.
translation: Este es el juego de las flores. Las reglas son las siguientes.

source_string: When you see a flower, press the button on the opposite side.
translation: Cuando veas una flor, presiona el botón del lado opuesto.

source_string: The flower is on the left side. Press the right button.
translation: La flor está en el lado izquierdo. Presione el botón derecho.

source_string: When you see a FLOWER, press the button on the OPPOSITE side.
translation: Cuando veas una FLOR, presiona el botón en el lado OPUESTO.

source_string: Now, we're going to play a game with hearts and flowers.
translation: Ahora, vamos a jugar un juego con corazones y flores.

source_string: Try to keep up!
translation: ¡Trata de seguir el ritmo!

source_string: If you make a mistake, just keep going!
translation: Si cometes un error, ¡sigue adelante!

source_string: Great job! You completed the game!
translation: ¡Bien hecho, has terminado el juego!

source_string: In this game, you are going to listen to words and look at different pictures. Your job is to pick the picture that matches the word!
translation: En este juego, escucharás palabras y observarás diferentes imágenes. ¡Tu tarea es elegir la imagen que coincida con la palabra!

source_string: You are going to see some different pictures. For example, a picture of an apple and a picture of a carrot. Then, you'll hear a word for one of the pictures. Make sure to pick the picture that matches the word!
translation: A continuación, verás algunas imágenes, por ejemplo, una imagen de una manzana y una imagen de una zanahoria. Luego, escucharás la palabra que identifica una de las imágenes. ¡Asegúrate de elegir la imagen que coincida con la palabra!

source_string: Some words are hard, and that's okay. If you're not sure, just give your best guess!
translation: Algunas palabras son difíciles, pero no te preocupes, si tienes dudas, ¡haz tu mejor intento!

source_string: If you need to hear the word again, press the speaker button.
translation: Si necesitas escuchar la palabra otra vez, presiona el botón del altavoz.

source_string: You can tap on a touchscreen, use the touchpad, or press the arrow keys for this activity. Try it now.
translation: You can tap on a touchscreen, use the touchpad, or press the arrow keys for this activity. Try it now.

source_string: To use an arrow key to choose a picture, press the key that points the same direction as the arrow below the picture.
translation: To use an arrow key to choose a picture, press the key that points the same direction as the arrow below the picture.

source_string: You can press the replay button to hear things again. Try it now.
translation: You can press the replay button to hear things again. Try it now.

source_string: This is a matching activity. Listen to what I say, then look at the pictures carefully. Choose the picture that goes with the words you hear.
translation: This is a matching activity. Listen to what I say, then look at the pictures carefully. Choose the picture that goes with the words you hear.

source_string: These questions ask you about how you feel at school and some of the things you do at school. There are no right or wrong answers. Choose the answer that best describes what you think. No, never; Yes, some of the time; Yes, most of the time; Yes, all of the time. The first two are for practice.
translation: Estas preguntas se refieren a cómo te sientes en la escuela, y a algunas de las cosas que haces en la escuela. No hay respuestas correctas ni incorrectas. Elige la respuesta que mejor diga lo que tú piensas. No, nunca; Sí, algunas veces; Sí, muchas veces; Sí, siempre. Las dos primeras preguntas son de práctica.

source_string: Do you like to read comic books?
translation: ¿Te gusta leer historietas (comics)?

source_string: Are you neat and tidy at school?
translation: ¿Eres limpio y ordenado en el colegio?

source_string: Is your teacher nice to you?
translation: ¿Te trata bien tu profesor?

translation: ¿Le caes bien a tu profesor?

translation: ¿Te escucha tu profesor?

source_string: Is school fun?
translation: ¿Te diviertes en el colegio?

source_string: Do you enjoy school?
translation: ¿Te gusta la escuela?

source_string: Are you happy at school?
translation: ¿Te sientes feliz en la escuela?

source_string: Do you feel safe at school?
translation: ¿Te sientes seguro o segura en el colegio?

source_string: Do you have friends in your class?
translation: ¿Tienes amigos o amigas en tu clase?

source_string: Do the kids in your class help you when you need it?
translation: ¿Te ayudan los niños y las niñas de tu clase cuando lo necesitas?

source_string: Do the kids in your class play with you?

source_string: When schoolwork is hard, do you give up right away?

source_string: Are you good at reading?

translation: ¿Eres bueno o buena para las matemáticas?

source_string: Some kids think they can get smarter if they work really hard. Do you think that you can get smarter if you work really hard?
translation: Algunos niños y niñas piensan que pueden ser más inteligentes si se esfuerzan mucho. ¿Crees que tú puedes ser más inteligente si te esfuerzas mucho?

source_string: Some kids think they can get better at reading if they work really hard. Do you think that you can get better at reading if you work really hard?

source_string: This is the Stories Game. In this game, you will listen to some stories. Then you will answer question about the stories.
translation: This is the Stories Game. In this game, you will listen to some stories. Then you will answer question about the stories.

source_string: Nice work! Here is a new story.
translation: Nice work! Here is a new story.

source_string: Here is Madison. This morning, Madison put her book behind the chair, because she didn’t want anyone to find it.
translation: Here is Madison. This morning, Madison put her book behind the chair, because she didn’t want anyone to find it.

source_string: But when Madison was outside playing, someone did find it! And hid it under the rug.
translation: But when Madison was outside playing, someone did find it! And hid it under the rug.

source_string: So now it’s reading time and Madison wants her book.
translation: So now it’s reading time and Madison wants her book.

source_string: Where will Madison look first for her book?
translation: Where will Madison look first for her book?

source_string: Behind the chair
translation: Behind the chair

source_string: Under the rug
translation: Under the rug

source_string: And where is her book really?
translation: And where is her book really?

source_string: Look, Madison found her book! How do you think she feels about finding her book?
translation: Look, Madison found her book! How do you think she feels about finding her book?

source_string: This morning when he came to school, Ethan put his book on the shelf above the coat hooks. Ethan’s book is blue!
translation: This morning when he came to school, Ethan put his book on the shelf above the coat hooks. Ethan’s book is blue!

source_string: And then he went outside to play, see? Here’s Ethan playing outside. And while he was outside playing, Ethan’s book fell down from above the coat hooks onto the floor under the coats, see?
translation: And then he went outside to play, see? Here’s Ethan playing outside. And while he was outside playing, Ethan’s book fell down from above the coat hooks onto the floor under the coats, see?

source_string: Then Hannah comes in and Hannah puts her book up above the coat hooks. Hannah's book is also blue! Ethan is still outside playing, so he didn't see what Hannah was doing.
translation: Then Hannah comes in and Hannah puts her book up above the coat hooks. Hannah's book is also blue! Ethan is still outside playing, so he didn't see what Hannah was doing.

source_string: Now, when Ethan comes in from outside, where will he look first for his book?
translation: Now, when Ethan comes in from outside, where will he look first for his book?

source_string: On the shelf
translation: On the shelf

source_string: Under the coats
translation: Under the coats

source_string: Let’s see what he does. Oh look, here is Ethan reaching for this book up on the shelf. And now Hannah sees Ethan reaching for that book... the book that Hannah thinks is hers!
translation: Let’s see what he does. Oh look, here is Ethan reaching for this book up on the shelf. And now Hannah sees Ethan reaching for that book... the book that Hannah thinks is hers!

source_string: How do you think Hannah feels about Ethan reaching for that book?
translation: How do you think Hannah feels about Ethan reaching for that book?

source_string: Is Ethan being mean and naughty for taking Hannah's book?
translation: Is Ethan being mean and naughty for taking Hannah's book?

source_string: Should Ethan get in trouble with the teacher for taking Hannah's book?
translation: Should Ethan get in trouble with the teacher for taking Hannah's book?

source_string: Can you help Hannah find her book? Is it on the shelf or under the coats?
translation: Can you help Hannah find her book? Is it on the shelf or under the coats?

source_string: Can you help Ethan find his book? Is it on the shelf or under the coats?
translation: Can you help Ethan find his book? Is it on the shelf or under the coats?

source_string: Joshua, Isabel, and Ivan are playing a game. Here's how the game goes: One kid hides, but draws a clue in the sandbox so the other kids can find them.
translation: Joshua, Isabel, and Ivan are playing a game. Here's how the game goes: One kid hides, but draws a clue in the sandbox so the other kids can find them.

source_string: So Ivan is going first. He draws this clue in the sandbox, and then he goes to hide.
translation: So Ivan is going first. He draws this clue in the sandbox, and then he goes to hide.

source_string: Now it's Joshua's turn to leave a clue, and hide. Isabel and Ivan will then try to use the clue to find him.
translation: Now it's Joshua's turn to leave a clue, and hide. Isabel and Ivan will then try to use the clue to find him.

source_string: Joshua decides to hide behind the fountain. He draws a clue in the sand. He tries to draw the bottom part and the water coming out of it. Joshua means to draw a fountain, but the drawing looks like a tree! Then Joshua goes to hide behind the fountain.
translation: Joshua decides to hide behind the fountain. He draws a clue in the sand. He tries to draw the bottom part and the water coming out of it. Joshua means to draw a fountain, but the drawing looks like a tree! Then Joshua goes to hide behind the fountain.

source_string: What did Joshua mean to draw?
translation: What did Joshua mean to draw?

source_string: A fountain
translation: A fountain

source_string: A tree
translation: A tree

source_string: When Isabel and Ivan see this clue, where will they look first for Joshua?
translation: When Isabel and Ivan see this clue, where will they look first for Joshua?

source_string: Can you help them find where Joshua really is?
translation: Can you help them find where Joshua really is?

source_string: Behind the fountain
translation: Behind the fountain

source_string: Behind the tree
translation: Behind the tree

source_string: Look, Isabel and Ivan found Joshua, and won the game! How do you think Isabel feels about winning the game?
translation: Look, Isabel and Ivan found Joshua, and won the game! How do you think Isabel feels about winning the game?

source_string: Now the games are over, and it's almost time to go home. Mother tells the kids to find all of their toys.
translation: Now the games are over, and it's almost time to go home. Mother tells the kids to find all of their toys.

source_string: Joshua brought his toy truck with him to the park, but now he can't find it. He's looking everywhere but he can't find it.
translation: Joshua brought his toy truck with him to the park, but now he can't find it. He's looking everywhere but he can't find it.

source_string: How does Joshua feel about losing his truck?
translation: How does Joshua feel about losing his truck?

source_string: Joshua can't find his truck because earlier in the day, when no one was looking, Isabel took the toy truck and buried it in the sandbox.
translation: Joshua can't find his truck because earlier in the day, when no one was looking, Isabel took the toy truck and buried it in the sandbox.

source_string: So Joshua looks everywhere and he can't find his toy truck. Mother gets mad at Joshua, because he lost his truck.
translation: So Joshua looks everywhere and he can't find his toy truck. Mother gets mad at Joshua, because he lost his truck.

source_string: Is it fair that Mother is mad at Joshua for losing his truck?
translation: Is it fair that Mother is mad at Joshua for losing his truck?

source_string: Is Mother mad at Isabel?
translation: Is Mother mad at Isabel?

source_string: Is Joshua mad at Isabel?
translation: Is Joshua mad at Isabel?

source_string: When Isabel sees that Mother is mad at Joshua, she goes to the sandbox and digs up the toy truck, and gives it back to Joshua.
translation: When Isabel sees that Mother is mad at Joshua, she goes to the sandbox and digs up the toy truck, and gives it back to Joshua.

source_string: Is Mother mad at Joshua now?
translation: Is Mother mad at Joshua now?

source_string: Is Mother mad at Isabel now?
translation: Is Mother mad at Isabel now?

source_string: Is Joshua mad at Isabel now?
translation: Is Joshua mad at Isabel now?

source_string: Isabel tells Joshua that she’s very sorry, and she gives him a big hug. Joshua gives her a big hug back, and Mother joins in.
translation: Isabel tells Joshua that she’s very sorry, and she gives him a big hug. Joshua gives her a big hug back, and Mother joins in.

source_string: Sam and Maria are playing together. They look outside and see a new shop across the street. Maria tells Sam: “I am going to buy new shirts for us there,” and she walks away.
translation: Sam and Maria are playing together. They look outside and see a new shop across the street. Maria tells Sam: “I am going to buy new shirts for us there,” and she walks away.

source_string: Mom comes home and she tells Sam that she just walked by the shop. “Are they selling shirts?” Sam asks. “No,” Mom says, “They are only selling shoes”. “Maria will probably now get shoes at the shop,” Sam says.
translation: Mom comes home and she tells Sam that she just walked by the shop. “Are they selling shirts?” Sam asks. “No,” Mom says, “They are only selling shoes”. “Maria will probably now get shoes at the shop,” Sam says.

source_string: Does Maria know that they are selling shoes in the shop?
translation: Does Maria know that they are selling shoes in the shop?

source_string: Maria has arrived at the shop. “I would like to buy shirts,” she says. “All we have left are socks,” says the shopkeeper. Since Maria also needs socks, she decides to get some socks.
translation: Maria has arrived at the shop. “I would like to buy shirts,” she says. “All we have left are socks,” says the shopkeeper. Since Maria also needs socks, she decides to get some socks.

source_string: Does Sam know that Maria bought some socks?
translation: Does Sam know that Maria bought some socks?

source_string: What does Sam think they are selling at the shop?
translation: What does Sam think they are selling at the shop?

source_string: Shoes
translation: Shoes

source_string: Socks
translation: Socks

source_string: Shirts
translation: Shirts

source_string:
On her way back, Maria meets her dad. She tells her dad: “I have just bought some socks. I am going to share them with my brother Sam. It is a surprise.”
“That is nice of you,” says Dad. Then he asks Maria: “Does Sam know what you bought him?”
translation:
On her way back, Maria meets her dad. She tells her dad: “I have just bought some socks. I am going to share them with my brother Sam. It is a surprise.”
“That is nice of you,” says Dad. Then he asks Maria: “Does Sam know what you bought him?”

source_string: Thank you to you and your child for participating in this research project! The following survey will take approximately 20-30 minutes to complete and will ask questions about your child. Some questions will note a specific timeframe to consider when answering. If no timeframe is indicated, you can think about how the answer applies to your child in general. When answering the questions, please think about your child who is participating in this research project. If you have more than one child participating in the research project, you will complete this survey separately for each participating child. We appreciate you answering as completely and accurately as possible with the information you have available to you. If you have questions about this survey, please reach out to the research coordinator. When you are ready to begin, select the “start survey” button. Thank you!
translation: Thank you to you and your child for participating in this research project! The following survey will take approximately 20-30 minutes to complete and will ask questions about your child. Some questions will note a specific timeframe to consider when answering. If no timeframe is indicated, you can think about how the answer applies to your child in general. When answering the questions, please think about your child who is participating in this research project. If you have more than one child participating in the research project, you will complete this survey separately for each participating child. We appreciate you answering as completely and accurately as possible with the information you have available to you. If you have questions about this survey, please reach out to the research coordinator. When you are ready to begin, select the “start survey” button. Thank you!

We are interested how often, independently, and easily your child shows each behavior when occasions call for it. Children who excel at a specific behavior should receive 4 (the highest rating), whereas most children will be between 3 and 2. Those who are still developing and need a lot of support should receive a rating of 1.

4 = Always on their own (No support needed)
3 = Mostly on their own (Brief reminders or support)
2 = Sometimes on their own (Regular reminders or moderate support needed)
1 = Not able on their own (Requires a lot of support)

source_string: Instructions: Think of this ladder as representing where people stand in <country>. At the top of the ladder are the people who are the best off - those who have the most money, the most education, and the most respected jobs. At the bottom are the people who are the worst off - those who have the least money, the least education, the least respected jobs, or no job. The higher up you are on this ladder, the closer you are to the people at the very top; the lower you are, the closer you are to the people at the very bottom.
translation: Instructions: Think of this ladder as representing where people stand in <country>. At the top of the ladder are the people who are the best off - those who have the most money, the most education, and the most respected jobs. At the bottom are the people who are the worst off - those who have the least money, the least education, the least respected jobs, or no job. The higher up you are on this ladder, the closer you are to the people at the very top; the lower you are, the closer you are to the people at the very bottom.

source_string:
Where would you place yourself on this ladder?
Please place a large "X" on the rung where you think you stand at this time in your life relative to other people in <country>.
translation:
Where would you place yourself on this ladder?
Please place a large "X" on the rung where you think you stand at this time in your life relative to other people in <country>.

source_string: Instructions: Think of this ladder as representing where people stand in their communities. People define community in different ways; please define it in whatever way is most meaningful to you. At the top of the ladder are people who have the highest standing in their community. At the bottom are the people who have the lowest standing in their community.
translation: Instructions: Think of this ladder as representing where people stand in their communities. People define community in different ways; please define it in whatever way is most meaningful to you. At the top of the ladder are people who have the highest standing in their community. At the bottom are the people who have the lowest standing in their community.

source_string:
Where would you place yourself on this ladder?
Please place a large "X" on the rung where you think you stand at this time in your life relative to other people in your community.

source_string: Thank you to you and your child for participating in this research project! The following survey will take approximately 20-30 minutes to complete and will ask questions about your child. Some questions will note a specific timeframe to consider when answering. If no timeframe is indicated, you can think about how the answer applies to your child in general. When answering the questions, please think about your child who is participating in this research project. If you have more than one child participating in the research project, you will complete this survey separately for each participating child. We appreciate you answering as completely and accurately as possible with the information you have available to you. If you have questions about this survey, please reach out to the research coordinator. When you are ready to begin, select the “start survey” button. Thank you!
translation:
¡Gracias a usted y a su niño(a) por participar en este proyecto de investigación! Estimamos que diligenciar la siguiente encuesta le tomará aproximadamente 40 minutos.
En la encuesta se le harán preguntas sobre su niño(a). En algunas preguntas se indica un marco temporal específico que debe tenerse en cuenta al responder. Si no se indica ningún marco temporal, puede pensar en cómo se aplica la respuesta a su hijo en general. Cuando responda a las preguntas, piense en su niño(a) que participa en este proyecto de investigación. Si tiene más de un(a) niño(a) que participa en el proyecto de investigación, rellenará esta encuesta por separado para cada uno de los niños participantes. Le agradecemos que responda la encuesta de la forma más precisa posible con la información de que dispone. Si tiene alguna duda, comuníquesela a quien apoya esta aplicación. Cuando esté listo(a) para empezar, seleccione el botón "Comenzar Encuesta". ¡Muchas gracias!
context:
CaregiverSurveyIntro
Welcome Page/Introducation
Sheet: Caregiver Survey

source_string: PART 1: At any point in time since your child was born, has your child seen or been present when the following experiences happened? Please include past and present experiences. Please note, some questions have more than one part separated by "OR." If any part of the question is answered "Yes," then the answer to the entire question is "Yes." Tally the number of statements that are TRUE for your child and enter the number in the box at the end of the list.
translation: Parte 1: En algún momento desde que nació, ¿Ha vivido o presenciado su niño(a) alguna de las siguientes situaciones? Incluya las experiencias pasadas o presentes. Tenga en cuenta que algunas preguntas tienen varias partes separadas por una “o”. Si alguna de las partes de la pregunta es cierta, entonces su respuesta debe ser “Sí”. Cuente el número de respuestas que respondió "Sí", que sean CIERTAS para su niño(a), y anote la cantidad en el cuadro al final de la lista de la Parte 1.
context:
ChildPACESpart1
Pediatric ACEs and Related Life Events Screener
Sheet: Caregiver Survey

source_string: Has your child ever lived with a parent/caregiver who went to jail/prison?

Pediatric ACEs and Related Life Events Screener
Sheet: Caregiver Survey

source_string:

source_string: Has a parent/caregiver ever insulted, humiliated, or put down your child?

source_string: Has the child's biological parent or any caregiver ever had, or currently has, a problem with too much alcohol, street drugs, or prescription medications use?
translation: ¿Tiene o tuvo alguna vez el padre, la madre o algún tutor problemas de consumo excesivo de alcohol, drogas o abuso de medicamentos con receta?
context:
ChildPACES5
Pediatric ACEs and Related Life Events Screener
Sheet: Caregiver Survey

source_string:
Has your child ever lacked appropriate care by any caregiver? 
(for example, not being protected from unsafe situations, or not cared for when sick or injured even when the resources were available)
translation: ¿Alguna vez le ha faltado el cuidado apropiado de parte de algún tutor (por ejemplo, no fue protegido de situaciones inseguras, no lo atendieron cuando estaba enfermo o lastimado, aun cuando había recursos disponibles)?
context:
ChildPACES6
Pediatric ACEs and Related Life Events Screener
Sheet: Caregiver Survey

source_string:
Has your child ever seen or heard a parent/caregiver being screamed at, sworn at, insulted, or humiliated by another adult?

Or has your child ever seen or heard a parent/caregiver being slapped, kicked, punched, beaten up, or hurt with a weapon?
translation:
¿Alguna vez vio o escuchó su niño(a) a otro adulto ofender, insultar o humillar a su padre, madre o tutor? 

O, ¿alguna vez su niño(a) vio o escuchó a su padre, madre o tutor ser abofeteado, pateado, golpeado o herido con un arma?
context:
ChildPACES7
Pediatric ACEs and Related Life Events Screener
Sheet: Caregiver Survey

source_string:
Has any adult in the household often or very often pushed, grabbed, slapped, or thrown something at your child?

Or has any adult in the household ever hit your child so hard that your child had marks or was injured?

Or has any adult in the household ever threatened your child or acted in a way that made your child afraid that they might be hurt?
translation:
¿Algún adulto en el hogar a menudo o muy a menudo ha empujado, sacudido, abofeteado o lanzado algún objeto a su niño(a)? 

O, ¿algún adulto en el hogar golpeó tan fuerte a su niño(a) que le quedaron marcas o heridas?

O, ¿algún adulto en el hogar amenazó a su niño(a) o actuó de una manera que lo hiciera sentir temor de sufrir un daño físico?
context:
ChildPACES8
Pediatric ACEs and Related Life Events Screener
Sheet: Caregiver Survey

source_string:
Has your child ever experienced sexual abuse?
(for example, anyone touched your child or asked your child to touch that person in a way that was unwanted, or made your child feel uncomfortable, or anyone ever attempted or actually had oral, anal, or vaginal sex with your child)
translation: ¿Alguna vez abusaron sexualmente a su niño(a)? (Por ejemplo, ¿alguna persona le tocó o le pidió que tocara a esa persona de una manera que su niño(a) no deseaba o que lo hiciera sentir incómodo(a), o alguna vez alguien intentó tener o tuvo sexo oral, anal o vaginal con su niño(a)?
context:
ChildPACES9
Pediatric ACEs and Related Life Events Screener
Sheet: Caregiver Survey

source_string:
Have there ever been significant changes in the relationship status of the child's caregiver(s)?

translation: ¿Alguna vez hubo cambios significativos en la relación sentimental del tutor o tutores del niño(a)? (Por ejemplo, los padres o tutores se separaron o divorciaron, una pareja sentimental se mudó al hogar o abandonó el hogar)

ChildPACES10

Sheet: Caregiver Survey

source_string:
We are interested how often, independently, and easily your child shows each behavior when occasions call for it. Children who excel at a specific behavior should receive 4 (the highest rating), whereas most children will be between 3 and 2. Those who are still developing and need a lot of support should receive a rating of 1.

4 = Always on their own (No support needed)
3 = Mostly on their own (Brief reminders or support)
2 = Sometimes on their own (Regular reminders or moderate support needed)
1 = Not able on their own (Requires a lot of support)
translation:
Nos interesa saber con qué frecuencia, de forma independiente, y facilidad  su niño(a) despliega estos comportamientos cuando la ocasión lo requiere. Los niños que sobresalen en un comportamiento específico deberían recibir una calificación de 4 (la puntuación más alta). La mayoría de niños recibirán calificaciones de 3 ó 2. Quienes aún están en desarrollo y requieren mucho apoyo deberían recibir una calificación de 1.  

4 = Siempre por sí mismo (no necesita apoyo)

3 = Generalmente por sí mismo (necesita poco apoyo o recordatorios breves) 

2 = A veces por sí mismo (necesita apoyo moderado o recordatorios regulares)

1 = No puede por sí mismo (necesita mucho apoyo)
context:
ChildEFQintro
Executive Function Questionnaire
Sheet: Caregiver Survey

source_string: Thank you again for participating in this research project! This part of the survey will take approximately 20-30 minutes to complete and will ask questions about your home and yourself. We appreciate you answering as completely and accurately as possible with the information you have available to you. If you have questions about this survey, please reach out to the research coordinator. When you are ready to begin, select the “start survey” button. Thank you!
translation:
¡Gracias de nuevo por participar en este proyecto de investigación! Estimamos que diligenciar la siguiente encuesta le tomará aproximadamente 20-30 minutos.
En la encuesta se le harán preguntas sobre su hogar y usted mismo(a). Le agradecemos que responda la encuesta de la forma más precisa posible con la información de que dispone. Si tiene alguna duda, comuníquesela a quien apoya esta aplicación. Cuando esté listo(a) para empezar, seleccione el botón "Comenzar Encuesta". ¡Muchas gracias!

source_string: Instructions: Think of this ladder as representing where people stand in <country>. At the top of the ladder are the people who are the best off - those who have the most money, the most education, and the most respected jobs. At the bottom are the people who are the worst off - those who have the least money, the least education, the least respected jobs, or no job. The higher up you are on this ladder, the closer you are to the people at the very top; the lower you are, the closer you are to the people at the very bottom.
translation: Instrucciones: Imagine que esta escalera representa la ubicación de las personas en <país>. En la parte superior de la escalera están las personas que están mejor: las que tienen más dinero, más educación y los trabajos más respetados. En la parte inferior están las personas que están peor: las que tienen menos dinero, menos educación, los trabajos menos respetados o sin empleo. Cuanto más arriba esté usted en esta escalera, más cerca estará de la gente de arriba; cuanto más abajo esté, más cerca estará de la gente de abajo.
context:
MacArthur Scale of Subjective Social Status
Sheet: Caregiver Survey

source_string:
Where would you place yourself on this ladder?
Please place a large "X" on the rung where you think you stand at this time in your life relative to other people in <country>.
translation:
¿Dónde se ubicaría usted en esta escalera?
Marque con una "X" grande el peldaño en el que crea que se encuentraa en este momento de su vida en relación con las otras personas de <país>.
context:
MacArthur Scale of Subjective Social Status
Sheet: Caregiver Survey

source_string: Instructions: Think of this ladder as representing where people stand in their communities. People define community in different ways; please define it in whatever way is most meaningful to you. At the top of the ladder are people who have the highest standing in their community. At the bottom are the people who have the lowest standing in their community.
translation: Instrucciones: Piense que esta escalera representa la posición de las personas en sus comunidades. La gente define la comunidad de distintas maneras; defínala según el significado que tenga para usted. En la parte superior de la escalera están las personas que gozan de mayor prestigio en su comunidad. En la parte inferior están las personas que tienen la posición más baja en su comunidad.
context:
MacArthur Scale of Subjective Social Status
Sheet: Caregiver Survey

source_string:
Where would you place yourself on this ladder?
Please place a large "X" on the rung where you think you stand at this time in your life relative to other people in your community.
translation:
¿Dónde se ubicaría usted en esta escalera?
Por favor, marque con una "X" grande el peldaño en el que crea que se encuentra en este momento de su vida en relación con las otras personas de su comunidad.
context:
MacArthur Scale of Subjective Social Status
Sheet: Caregiver Survey

source_string: These questions ask you about how you feel at school and some of the things you do at school. There are no right or wrong answers. Choose the answer that best describes what you think. No, never; Yes, some of the time; Yes, most of the time; Yes, all of the time. The first two are for practice.
translation: Estas preguntas se refieren a cómo te sientes en la escuela, y a algunas de las cosas que haces en la escuela. No hay respuestas correctas ni incorrectas. Elige la respuesta que mejor diga lo que tú piensas. No, nunca; Sí, algunas veces; Sí, muchas veces; Sí, siempre. Las dos primeras preguntas son de práctica.

source_string:
"Thank you for taking the time (~10 minutes) to respond to this survey!

Some students who you teach are participating in a research project studying how children learn and develop. Your responses in this survey should apply to your classroom, school, and professional beliefs rather than to any one specific child. 

This survey has two parts: Part A and Part B. In Part A, the questions relate to your background and beliefs. In Part B the questions are classroom specific. If you teach more than one class of students included in this project, you will complete Part B separately for each classroom. If you teach a single subject, please complete the questions that relate to other subjects to the best of your knowledge or consult with a colleague for those details only. 

Thank you for your participation! Your responses provide invaluable insight into the education of your students. 

When you are ready to begin, select the “start survey” button.

Thank you!"
translation:
¡Gracias por dedicarnos unos minutos de su tiempo (aproximadamente 10 minutos) para responder esta encuesta!
 
Algunos de sus alumnos están participando en un proyecto de investigación que estudia cómo aprenden y se desarrollan los niños. Por favor conteste esta encuesta pensando para sus respuestas en su salón, colegio y creencias profesionales, pero no en un niño(a) en particular.
 
Esta encuesta consta de dos partes: Parte A y Parte B. En la Parte A, las preguntas indaga por sus antecedentes y creencias. En la Parte B, las preguntas indaga por el aula en concreto. Si imparte clases a más de un grupo, responda a las preguntas considerando el grupo de alumnos que participan en este proyecto. Si enseña una sola asignatura, responda las preguntas relacionadas con otras asignaturas según su conocimiento o consulte a un colega solo acerca de esos detalles.
 
Gracias por su participación. Sus respuestas proporcionan una valiosa información sobre la educación de sus alumnos.
 
Cuando desee empezar, seleccione el botón "Comenzar Encuesta".


¡Gracias!

source_string: This is Part B of the survey. In Part B the questions are classroom specific. If you teach more than one class of students included in this project, you will complete Part B separately for each classroom. If you teach a single subject, please complete the questions that relate to other subjects to the best of your knowledge or consult with a colleague for those details only. When you are ready to begin, select the “start survey” button. Thank you!
translation: Esta es la Parte B de la encuesta. En la Parte B las preguntas son específicas para cada aula. Si enseña a más de una clase de los alumnos incluidos en este proyecto, cumplimentará la Parte B por separado para cada clase. Si enseña una sola asignatura, complete las preguntas que se refieren a otras asignaturas según su leal saber y entender o consulte con un colega sólo para esos detalles. Cuando esté listo para empezar, seleccione el botón "comenzar encuesta". Muchas gracias.

source_string: item_text
translation: item_text_es-co

source_string:
We are interested how often, independently, and easily your child shows each behavior when occasions call for it. Children who excel at a specific behavior should receive 4 (the highest rating), whereas most children will be between 3 and 2. Those who are still developing and need a lot of support should receive a rating of 1.

4 = Always on their own (No support needed)
3 = Mostly on their own (Brief reminders or support)
2 = Sometimes on their own (Regular reminders or moderate support needed)
1 = Not able on their own (Requires a lot of support)
translation:
Nos interesa saber con qué frecuencia, de forma independiente, y facilidad  su niño(a) despliega estos comportamientos cuando la ocasión lo requiere. Los niños que sobresalen en un comportamiento específico deberían recibir una calificación de 4 (la puntuación más alta). La mayoría de niños recibirán calificaciones de 3 ó 2. Quienes aún están en desarrollo y requieren mucho apoyo deberían recibir una calificación de 1.  

4 = Siempre por sí mismo (no necesita apoyo)

3 = Generalmente por sí mismo (necesita poco apoyo o recordatorios breves) 

2 = A veces por sí mismo (necesita apoyo moderado o recordatorios regulares)

1 = No puede por sí mismo (necesita mucho apoyo)
context:
ChildEFQintro
Executive Function Questionnaire
Sheet: EF

source_string: Pays attention when an adult is explaining or showing something ... (by listening carefully and/or watching with appropriate eye gaze/body orientation.)
translation: Presta atención cuando un adulto está explicando o mostrando algo (escuchando atentamente y observando la demostración con contacto visual y orientación corporal adecuadas).
context:
ChildEFQ1
Executive Function Questionnaire
Sheet: EF

source_string: Finishes an assigned task that is repetitive (e.g., picking up toys, putting away laundry)
translation: Concluye una tarea repetitiva asignada (por ejemplo, recoger los juguetes, guardar la ropa).
context:
ChildEFQ2
Executive Function Questionnaire
Sheet: EF

source_string: Remains focused and engaged during lengthy adult-led activities (e.g., religious or performance event, family meal time) by listening carefully and contributing when appropriate.
translation: Se mantiene concentrado e involucrado durante las actividades prolongadas dirigidas por adultos (por ejemplo, presentaciones o actos religiosos, comidas en familia), escuchando atentamente y participando apropiadamente.
context:
ChildEFQ3
Executive Function Questionnaire
Sheet: EF

source_string: Remains focused and engaged during collaborative child-led activities (e.g., playing with siblings/peers)
translation: Se mantiene concentrado e involucrado durante las actividades de colaboración dirigidas por niños (por ejemplo, jugando con sus hermanos o compañeros).
context:
ChildEFQ4
Executive Function Questionnaire
Sheet: EF

source_string: Persists on a difficult cognitive/learning task (e.g., homework) by trying to figure things out, asking questions, and not quitting
translation: Persiste en una tarea difícil (por ejemplo, los deberes) tratando de resolverla, haciendo preguntas, sin desistir.
context:
ChildEFQ5
Executive Function Questionnaire
Sheet: EF

source_string: Gets deeply engaged in an activity they choose for themselves (e.g., drawing, reading, cooking, building, sports, games)
translation: Se involucra a fondo en una actividad elegida por él/ella (por ejemplo, dibujar, leer, cocinar, construir, hacer deporte, jugar).
context:
ChildEFQ6
Executive Function Questionnaire
Sheet: EF

source_string: Ignores irrelevant activity/noise (e.g., crying sibling, TV, outside traffic) when working on an assigned task
translation: Ignora actividades y ruidos irrelevantes (por ejemplo, el llanto de un hermano, la televisión, el tráfico) cuando trabaja en una tarea asignada.
context:
ChildEFQ7
Executive Function Questionnaire
Sheet: EF

source_string: Completes an assigned task before moving to a next task
translation: Completa la tarea asignada antes de pasar a la siguiente.
context:
ChildEFQ8
Executive Function Questionnaire
Sheet: EF

source_string: Regains focus/focuses again on an assigned task when interrupted (e.g., family member asks an unrelated question or needs brief assistance)
translation: Recupera la concentración o vuelve a centrarse en una tarea asignada cuando se le interrumpe (por ejemplo, un miembro de la familia hace una pregunta no relacionada o solicita ayuda).
context:
ChildEFQ9
Executive Function Questionnaire
Sheet: EF

source_string: Ignores a preferred, fun activity (e.g., playing) when asked to complete an assigned task (e.g., cleaning room)

context:
ChildEFQ10
Executive Function Questionnaire
Sheet: EF

source_string: Answers questions or tells a story without getting distracted by small details and/or losing train of thought
translation: Responde a preguntas o cuenta una historia sin distraerse con pequeños detalles ni perder el hilo de sus pensamientos.
context:
ChildEFQ11
Executive Function Questionnaire
Sheet: EF

source_string: Waits turn to speak (e.g., does not interrupt others, does not blurt out answers, thinks before speaking)
translation: Espera su turno para hablar (p. ej., no interrumpe a los demás, no apresura sus respuestas, piensa antes de hablar)

ChildEFQ12
Executive Function Questionnaire
Sheet: EF

source_string: Stops an undesirable behavior when asked (e.g., stops fighting with sibling when asked by parent, stops misbehaving in the household)
translation: Detiene un comportamiento indeseable cuando se lo piden (por ejemplo: deja de pelearse con un hermano cuando se lo piden sus padres, deja de portarse mal en casa).

ChildEFQ13
Executive Function Questionnaire
Sheet: EF

translation: Deja de jugar o de hacer algo divertido cuando se lo piden (por ejemplo, deja de jugar con sus amigos o deja de ver la televisión cuando se lo piden sus padres).

ChildEFQ14
Executive Function Questionnaire
Sheet: EF

source_string: Waits for their turn to act (e.g., waits patiently in line at a grocery store or when sharing a toy with sibling)

ChildEFQ15
Executive Function Questionnaire
Sheet: EF

source_string: Stops and thinks before acting (e.g., does not run out in front of a car, does not grab things they shouldn't)
translation: Se detiene y piensa antes de actuar (por ejemplo, no se lanza corriendo delante de un vehículo, no toma un objeto que no debería).
context:
ChildEFQ16
Executive Function Questionnaire
Sheet: EF

source_string: Completes activities that require multiple steps (e.g., fetching multiple things in home or store/market, setting the table, cleaning a room by putting several things away)
translation: Completa actividades que requieren varios pasos (por ejemplo, ir a buscar varias cosas a la casa o al mercado, poner la mesa, limpiar una habitación guardando varias cosas).

ChildEFQ17
Executive Function Questionnaire
Sheet: EF

source_string: Completes activities that require remembering lengthy instructions (e.g., rules of a game, household chores, cooking recipe)
translation: Completa actividades que requieren recordar instrucciones largas (p. ej., reglas de un juego, tareas domésticas, receta de cocina).

ChildEFQ18
Executive Function Questionnaire
Sheet: EF

source_string: Communicates in an organized way (e.g., retells the correct sequence of the events, explains how a game works so it is easy to understand)
translation: Se comunica de forma organizada (por ejemplo, vuelve a contar la secuencia correcta de los acontecimientos, explica cómo funciona un juego para que sea fácil de entender).

ChildEFQ19
Executive Function Questionnaire
Sheet: EF

source_string: Completes age-appropriate numerical mental calculation (e.g., adds prices of goods, calculates time, how much they are older than someone else)
translation: Realiza cálculos mentales numéricos apropiados para su edad (por ejemplo, suma precios de productos, calcula el tiempo, la diferencia de edad que hay entre él/ella y otra persona).

ChildEFQ20
Executive Function Questionnaire
Sheet: EF

source_string: Remembers and considers all options when making a choice (e.g., what to do when they get stuck on a household task or face a problem, food options)
translation: Recuerda y considera todas las opciones a la hora de elegir (por ejemplo, qué hacer cuando se complica una tarea doméstica o se enfrenta a un problema, qué comida elegir)

ChildEFQ21
Executive Function Questionnaire
Sheet: EF

source_string: Remembers physical directions, patterns, and where things are (e.g., knows walking routes, finds things in a grocery store, good at searching for a lost item or playing hide-and-seek)
translation: Recuerda direcciones, patrones y ubicación de las cosas (por ejemplo, conoce las rutas para caminar, encuentra las cosas en una tienda de comestibles, es hábil buscando un objeto perdido o jugando al escondite).

Executive Function Questionnaire
Sheet: EF

source_string: Comes up with new ways for solving challenges (e.g., repurposes materials or toys, comes up with a new way to build a tower or fort after it collapses, solves a puzzle in a new way, comes up with a new strategy to complete a chore)
translation: Inventa nuevas formas de resolver problemas (por ejemplo, reutiliza materiales o juguetes, inventa una nueva forma de construir una torre o un castillo después de que se derrumba, resuelve un rompecabezas de una forma nueva, inventa una nueva estrategia para completar una tarea).

ChildEFQ23
Executive Function Questionnaire
Sheet: EF

source_string: Expresses themselves in a new way when not understood by others (e.g., tries different ways to communicate their needs and wants)
translation: Se expresa de forma diferente cuando los demás no le entienden (por ejemplo, intenta comunicar sus necesidades y deseos de distintas maneras).

ChildEFQ24
Executive Function Questionnaire
Sheet: EF

source_string: Adjusts when plans/schedules change (e.g., follows along when daily schedule changes, does not complain when unexpected sickness leads to canceling a family vacation)
translation: Se adapta cuando cambian los planes u horarios (p. ej., se adapta cuando cambian los horarios, no se queja cuando una enfermedad inesperada obliga a cancelar las vacaciones familiares).

Executive Function Questionnaire
Sheet: EF

source_string: Understands conflicting perspectives/ideas (e.g., acknowledges a different point of view, accepts different ways of doing things, can see a situation from someone else’s perspective)
translation: Entiende las posiciones o ideas contradictorias (por ejemplo, reconoce un punto de vista diferente, acepta distintas formas de hacer las cosas, puede ver una situación desde la perspectiva de otra persona).

Sheet: EF

translation: Conecta unas ideas y experiencias con otras ideas y experiencias (por ejemplo, identifica las conexiones entre libros o películas y experiencias vividas, utiliza estrategias aprendidas en la escuela para completar actividades en casa).

Sheet: EF

translation: Adapta su comportamiento en función de lo que requiere la situación (por ejemplo, cambia de personaje o papel en un juego, cambia su comportamiento en función a que se encuentra en tiempo de juego o tiempo de estudio).
